intro: Lithocardium senegalense, commonly known as the Senegalese stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the arid regions of West Africa. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that store water, allowing it to survive in dry conditions. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, adding ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it suitable for rock gardens or xeriscaping. Due to its hardy nature, it is often cultivated as a drought-tolerant ornamental plant.
